snippet: A suicide bomber killed at least 13 schoolchildren and a headmaster and wounded 80 others, the police said. It was the first of three attacks that left at least 31 people dead.
abstract: Suicide bomber detonates truck filled with explosives on playground of elementary school in Qabak, Iraq, killing 13 children and headmaster; separately, another suicide truck bomb strikes police station in the same village, killing three officers; attacks add to growing wave of violence across Iraq, deadliest outbreak since 2008.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Mosul, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: A suicide bomber killed at least 13 schoolchildren and a headmaster and wounded 80 others, the police said. It was the first of three attacks that left at least 31 people dead.

headline.main: Bomber Kills 13 Children At Iraq School Playground
headline.print_headline: Bomber Kills 13 Children At Iraq School Playground
